After playing for a month I still have no idea what half the stuff does. Cards for this, options for that, tickets for this, tokens for that, a bazillion cars with no menu that calls up just the ones you own, another bazillion events/races/dailies, upgrade this, modify that, there's even like 4 different "currencies" to grind for to do god knows what with. It's like coder's first day with options menus. "Let's add MOAR! Never enuff opshuns!" Such a mess of menus banners and pop-ups, and NONE OF IT explained very well, if at all. 2 stars off for the tsunami of obfuscation, but I'd give it 5 stars if they cut the upgrading crap by like 3/4.

I almost forgot all in game currency is so hard to get like the blue token things for example: the game offers you no tokens and even if you do get one you‚Äôd would have like 10 or 50 and cars are like 10000 tokens. title.label: Constantly lose money, progress; Horrid customer service

content.label: You will spend hours and hours working your way through progressive challenges to earn money to buy more cars; And every once in a while they offer a deal to earn more credits and buy better cars. And several times along the way Gameloft will lose your progress and your cars and your in-game money. For example, I have a *NEGATIVE* 4 million-plus dollar in-game money balance. And it is because they have lost my progress, yet again, and you email them and provide all the information and they *STILL* copy-paste a response that ignores the fact you already sent your game ID. And you respond yet again that your progress has not been restored and you get ZERO response. DON'T play this game & DON'T spend money on it!
They should have different payment options between Fusion coins, Tokens, and Credit coins to purchase cars and upgrades for those cars in game
This is the best game for the free time you have or it‚Äôs just me I like playing on free time

title.label: Multiplayer campaign WAS great, now it‚Äôs p2w.

content.label:
Asphalt 8 was once a great all-round game, able to be played online and offline and the rewards were numerous. 
However, Gameloft‚Äôs recent update removed the ability to earn purple ‚Äúrepair‚Äù tokens, making it so you have to actually spend real money to earn them, and this makes it impossible to complete mastery mode and in Multiplayer, there are now countless p2w players who spend actual money to acquire Ariel Atoms, and they dominate literally every race every time of the day.
This defeats the purpose of f2p in event modes and in multiplayer and the only reason I‚Äôm still able to earn large rewards in events is because I managed to get my hands on a class S Bugatti Chiron, which is dominant in S class.
I definitely like how Gameloft hasn‚Äôt screwed up Career mode, and I also like how you can still play Career mode and succeed. With this being said, Asphalt 8 is still a great game, but don‚Äôt even think about playing Multiplayer anymore unless you have real cash at hand to buy an Ariel Atom. This game is definitely a brilliant game to play offline and the numerous options are great, so if you plan to get this game, it‚Äôs great to play offline and runs smoothly but otherwise, resort to Asphalt 9 for good, fair multiplayer races.
